featured.text: When I asked if she was angry about what she had lost, she admitted to being frustrated occasionally, “especially when everybody’s dancing, because I love to dance.
By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
The angry passengers argued ______ with the airline staff because their flight was cancelled without any reason.
They feel angry about the regained weight.
The problem with Jane is that she tends to take criticism too and gets angry easily.

definition.en_def: Feeling or showing strong annoyance, displeasure, or hostility.
definition.example: She was angry when she found out someone had taken her lunch.
